issue.title: Incorrect size of the object when saved file is opened

content.raw:
I also observer a similar issue in Gazebo 7 (ROS Indigo). Steps to reproduce:

1. `roslaunch gazebo_ros empty_world.launch`
2. Insert a model (like the construction cone) into the world.
3. Save the world file to disk and close gazebo (e.g in `/tmp/1.sdf`)
4. Relaunch gazebo with the world file from step 3: `roslaunch gazebo_ros empty_world.launch world_file:=/tmp/1.sdf`

The original model:

![orig.jpg](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/89402489-orig.jpg)

The model after reloading. The scale is totally wrong:

![bad.jpg](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/2792082842-bad.jpg)

By reinserting the model again into the saved world, I can observe that the `collision/geom/scale` of the new box is set to `10 10 10` while for the saved model it is `1 1 1`. I suspect that the `save world` implementation does not save the scale for some of the models correctly.
